lead_paragraph: Former mobster James "Whitey" Bulger, convicted of participating in 11 murders during the 1970s and '80s, will not get a new trial, a federal appeals court ruled on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Denies Former Mob Boss a New Trial
headline.main: Court Rejects Ex-Gangster Whitey Bulger's Bid for New Trial

snippet: Former mobster James "Whitey" Bulger, convicted of participating in 11 murders during the 1970s and '80s, will not get a new trial, a federal appeals court ruled on Friday.
abstract: Federal appeals court denies former Boston mobster James (Whitey) Bulger new trial due to lack of evidence; Bulger claims he received unfair trial in 2013 when judge barred him from discussing immunity he supposedly received from deceased  assistant United States attorney.
